com.admob.android.ads
Class AdView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.RelativeLayout
              com.admob.android.ads.AdView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
public class AdView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout

A view containing an ad.

AdMob ads are 320x48 device independent pixels (dip or dp). By defining the ad's size in dip, the ad will be scaled properly across the different Android screen sizes.

You can adjust an ad's background and font colors to better match the color scheme of your application. For example, you may want to have the same ad font color as the background of the rest of the screen.

To improve the relevance of advertisements you can supply hints. The setKeywords(String) method describes your application and the screen the ad is on. For example if this page is a recipe for chocolate cake you might set keywords to "cookbook recipe chocolate cake" for your ad. If this ad sits next to search results, which are more specific, you can use the setSearchQuery(String) method. There are additional methods that improve relevancy across the application in AdManager.

To have the view show a new ad call requestFreshAd(). Only use this feature if you expect the user to be viewing that screen for an extended period of time (longer than 60 seconds). Otherwise, frequent requests of ads will not improve revenue and may actually hurt both revenue and user experience.

Use setAdListener(AdListener) to get ad state change notifications like when the ad arrived from the server. Use View.setOnClickListener(OnClickListener) to get notified when the user clicks on the ad. If the user clicks on the same ad multiple times you will get multiple click notifications, but you will see stats on admob.com and earn money only for the first click.

Method Detail

requestFreshAd

public void requestFreshAd()
Updates this view with a new ad. This will be ignored if you have previously used setRequestInterval(int) to request fresh ads for you.

getRequestInterval

public int getRequestInterval()
Gets the ad's request interval as set by setRequestInterval(int), which will be used to determine when an ad is refreshed. CPM ads will never refresh.

Returns:
The number of seconds between displaying new ads. The default is 0 which means new ads will not be displayed unless requestFreshAd is called.

setRequestInterval

public void setRequestInterval(int requestInterval)
Makes this view display a new ad every requestInterval seconds, overriding any requestFreshAd calls. This is a convenience method for ads on screens that are displayed for a long period of time.

Only use this feature if you expect the user to be viewing that screen for an extended period of time (usually longer than 60 seconds). Otherwise, frequent requests of ads will not improve revenue and may actually hurt both revenue and user experience.

Parameters:
requestInterval - is how many seconds to wait before replacing this ad with a new one. If you use this method 20 seconds is a good value. Set this to 0 to turn this feature off.

onWindowFocusChanged

public void onWindowFocusChanged(boolean hasWindowFocus)
Called when the window containing this ad view gains or loses focus. The ad uses this event to clean up resources.

Overrides:
onWindowFocusChanged in class android.view.View

Gets the main text's color, as set by setPrimaryTextColor(int).

Returns:
The color of the ad's main text.
See Also:
R.color

setPrimaryTextColor

public void setPrimaryTextColor(int primaryTextColor)
Sets the main text's color. Some ads have additional descriptive "subtext" that can be set to a secondary color with setSecondaryTextColor(int).

This can also be set in the XML layout by using the primaryTextColor attribute.

Parameters:
primaryTextColor - ARGB value for the ad's main text.
See Also:
R.color

getSecondaryTextColor

public int getSecondaryTextColor()
Gets the secondary text color, as set by setSecondaryTextColor(int).

Returns:
The color of the ad's subtext.
See Also:
R.color

setSecondaryTextColor

public void setSecondaryTextColor(int secondaryTextColor)
Sets the subtext's color. Subtext is additional descriptive "subtext" used in some ads. This color should compliment the primary text color while being less intense. For example if the primary text is white this could be a light gray.

This can also be set in the XML layout by using the secondaryTextColor attribute.

Parameters:
secondaryTextColor - ARGB value for the ad's subtext.
See Also:
R.color

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(int color)
Sets the ad's background color. A "shine" is applied over it which appears as to reflect light from above the ad.

This can also be set in the XML layout by using the backgroundColor attribute.

Overrides:
setBackgroundColor in class android.view.View
Parameters:
color - ARGB value for the ad.
See Also:
R.color

getBackgroundColor

public int getBackgroundColor()
Gets the background color for this ad, as set by setBackgroundColor(int).

Returns:
The background ARGB color value for the ad.
See Also:
R.color

getKeywords

public java.lang.String getKeywords()
Gets keywords, if any, as set for this ad in setKeywords(String).

Returns:
The optional set of keywords that describe this application and where the ad appears or null.

setKeywords

public void setKeywords(java.lang.String keywords)
Keywords are hints that describe your application and the screen an ad appears on and may be used for better ad targeting. For example, if the ad was at the bottom of a game of checkers you might set this to "checkers game".

This can also be set in the XML layout by using the keywords attribute.

Parameters:
keywords - is an optional set of words that describe your application and where the ad appears. Keywords can be removed by setting this to null.

getSearchQuery

public java.lang.String getSearchQuery()
Gets optional search query, as set by setSearchQuery(String).

Returns:
The optional search query this ad appears within or null.

setSearchQuery

public void setSearchQuery(java.lang.String searchQuery)
If this ad appears alonside search results provide the search query here. Search queries differ from keywords in that they are more specific.

Parameters:
searchQuery - is an optional search query if this ad appears within search results.

setGoneWithoutAd

@Deprecated
public void setGoneWithoutAd(boolean hide)
Deprecated. For setGoneWithoutAd(true) set the width and/or height to WRAP_CONTENT or FILL_PARENT. For setGoneWithoutAd(false) set the width to 320dip and height to 48dip.

The default behavior of this view depends on how you initially sized it.
  • If this view's width is set to 320dip and the height to 48dip the view will occupy space, but will not show anything until the ad is returned from the server. This is logically equivalent to the visibility being View.INVISIBLE until the ad arrives and then becoming View.VISIBLE.
  • If either the width or height are WRAP_CONTENT or FILL_PARENT this view will by zero-by-zero pixels. This is because, like a WebView, the ad view only knows how to occupy space when its content is returned from the server. And when the ad is returned from the server this view will re-measure itself to 320dip by 48dip. This is logically equivalent to the visibility being View.GONE until the ad arrives and then becoming View.VISIBLE.

Other behaviors can be built using the AdListener interface.

isGoneWithoutAd

@Deprecated
public boolean isGoneWithoutAd()
Deprecated. See setGoneWithoutAd(boolean) for details.

setVisibility

public void setVisibility(int visibility)
Makes the ad visible or hides it.

When making this ad VISIBLE consider applying an animation as well. For example if this ad is hidden during a game, and then the game ends so it becomes visible, an animation will look more professional while subtly calling attention to it. Here is sample code that makes the ad appear: 


        // Unhide the ad.
        thisAdView.setVisibility( View.VISIBLE );
 
        // Fade the ad in over 4/10 of a second.
        AlphaAnimation animation = new AlphaAnimation( 0.0f, 1.0f );
        animation.setDuration( 400 );
        animation.setFillAfter( true );
        animation.setInterpolator( new AccelerateInterpolator() );
        thisAdView.startAnimation( animation );

Overrides:
setVisibility in class android.view.View
Parameters:
visibility - is one of VISIBLE, INVISIBLE, or GONE.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Set the enabled state of this view. Disabling an ad view causes its visiblity to change to View.GONE. Enabling an ad always changes the visiblity to View.VISIBLE.

Using this method over setting the visibility yourself only is helpful if you want to check isEnabled later in your code as a reminder of its state.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class android.view.View
Parameters:
enabled - true if this view is enabled, false otherwise.

setAdListener

public void setAdListener(AdListener listener)
Makes the listener receive notifications of when a new ad has arrived from AdMob and this view is about to display it. The listener is a good place to change the colors of an ad or hide the view when there is no ad.

Parameters:
listener - is the object to receive event notifications or null to stop getting notifications.

getAdListener

public AdListener getAdListener()
Returns the ad listener previously registered through setAdListener(AdListener).

Returns:
The listener previously registered through setAdListener(AdListener). Will be null if nothing has been registered.

hasAd

public boolean hasAd()
Says whether this view is showing an ad or not. Before an ad is ready to be shown, it must be downloaded from AdMob servers; this takes a fraction of a second.

It is possible that no ad is returned. Likely reasons are that there were no ads to display to the user at that moment or user has a connection problem.

Returns:
true if this view is showing an ad or false if it is empty.

cleanup

public void cleanup()
Aggressively frees memory used by this view when it is no longer being used. Optionally call to have images and other data released immediately. It is rare you will need to use this method as most applications can wait for the garbage collector.
